answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that might help answer your question regarding after hours on-call pay.
This article is from the legal group called NOLO. 
http://www.nolo.com/legal-encyclopedia/paying-employees-business-travel-on-call-30074.html
I also included a link to the US Department of labor Overtime Compensation guidelines under the Fair Labor Standards Act.
http://www.osha.gov/pls/epub/wageindex.download?p_file=F28282/wh1325.pdf
These three cities also have on-call water and sewer employees. You may want to contact them directly for more information on how they handle pay for these workers.
Manchester, TN
http://www.cityofmanchestertn.com/index.aspx?NID=78
Hutchinson, KS
http://hutchgov.com/department/division.asp?fDD=23-112
Pontiac, MI
http://www.pontiac.mi.us/departments/dpw_watersewer.html
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Paul Brown
text: Currently, our water/sewer workers who have mandated after-hours/on-call status recieve .25 cents extra per hour for weeks that they are on-call, for a total of $32 extra dollars a week.  If they receive any callouts, they are for a minimum of 2 hours at overtime rate.  Just wondering how other organizations handle these type of work situations.  Thanks for any information you can offer.
title: After-hours on-call stipend for water/sewer employees
